From a defensive standpoint, you've got to keep him from controlling the game and monopolizing the game. That's what we have to try and do with Aaron Rodgers . He's a great player. He can create, improvise with his feet, go to his second and third choice in the route because he has such a quick release. The 6-foot-5, 241-pound Ben Roethlisberger isn't as speedy as Aaron Rodgers or Michael Vick nor as statuesque as Tom Brady and Peyton Manning ; he just makes it work. There has also been talk of tension between Eric Schmidt and Page on competing priorities, Seth Harris added, with Eric Schmidt emphasizing the need to protect margins and Page pushing for more innovation. Google has to do both but is losing talent and facing tough competition, so the balance is tough to reach, he concluded. All of this is true, but replacing Eric Schmidt with Page is not necessarily the answer, said Seth Harris Dalka, a digital strategy consultant and keynote speaker.

Eric Schmidt Steps Down; Co-founder Page is New Google CEO Mark Hefflinger on January 20, 2011- 10:35 am. Mountain View, Calif.- Citing a desire to streamline decision making and create clearer lines of responsibility at the top of the company, Google on Thursday announced that CEO Eric Schmidt will step down, becoming executive chairman, while co-founder Larry Page will take over as chief executive.
